result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court  reads in two attempted burglaries for Schroeder's Auto Sales & Motor Sports Marine and  grants 60 days for State to determine restitution.

*Amended to reflect restitution is joint and several*

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes:
Can be served in any county in State of Wisconsin.
Commence on or before 7-30-15 @ 6 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Johnson

records.addlTxt: 02:11 PM Defendant Michael James Johnson in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Michael James Johnson in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reviewed revocation summary. No additions or corrections. State is not joining Dept's recommendation. Presents arguments and recommends on ct 1 - 6 yrs prison, 4 yrs ic, 2 yrs es. State has complied with VWNR. $325.75 restitution still owed. For ct 2 - 1 yr ic, 1 yr es concurrent to ct 1. Believes 637 days credit. Atty Seifert presents sentencing arguments. Believes 638 days credit. Asks for time served and ext supv. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders on ct 1 - 6 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 4 yrs es. ct 2 - 2 yrs prison, 1 yr ic, 1 yr es, concurrent. Credit for 638 days served. Def will take care of financial obligations under supervision. 15FO194 Warrant quashed - convert to civil judgment. Def eligible for SAP and CIP. Postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 19, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael James Johnson in court  & in custody with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 9:18 am.  Victim rights complied with.  State gives plea agreement, plea to both ct's, Read in attempt burglary for restitution, ct 1 withheld sentence 3 yrs probation, Restitution 1023.00 Little Hummers Bar & 60 days restitution for read in cts. , counseling deemed appropriate, 1 year jail, costs ct 2 withheld sentence 3 yrs probation, concurrent, counseling & costs, 54 days credit if revoked. 30 days to commence jail sentence from today.  Can be served in Winnebago Co. Atty Schuster explains why requesting 30 days jail,  Def. agrees with plea agreement.   Waiver of Preliminary examination. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information filed. Atty Schuster has copy of information. Plea questionnaire filed.  Ct 1 Burglary, ptac & Ct 2 Poss of Burglarious Tools, ptac,  Court goes over elements, Ct 1 no contest plea, & Ct 2 no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. advised of U.S. citizenship law. Atty Schuster is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily, accepts plea. Stipulate to factual basis in complaint, & finds factual bases & finds def. Guilty to both ct's. Proceed to sentencing.  Atty Schuster gives statement.  Def. makes statement. No victims present
Court accepts plea agreement & orders ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, Restitution $1023.00 to Little Hummers Bar, Counseling deemed appropriate by agent, 1 year jail,  huber privileges,   Can be served in any county in State of WI. 54 days credit if revoked, C. 30 days to start jail, C. on or before 7-30-15 6 pm, costs
ct 2 withheld sentence 3 years probation, concurrent with ct 1 counseling deemed approopriate by agent & costs   on ct 1 Court will  grant 60 days for State to determine restitution for Schroeder Auto Sale & Motorsport Marine on read in.  Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. DNA Surcharge & sample. Court advise def. may petition for expungement on DNA Sample, def. can check in to. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court will read in two attempted burglaries for Schroeder Auto & Motorsports Marine.
No use of alcohol.  No contact with Little Hummers Bar, Schroeder Auto and Motor Sport Marine

Defendant Michael James Johnson in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Michael James Johnson in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Argument presented by Atty Schuster for bond to be reduced.  Response by State.  Court will reduce bond  Time limits waived for preliminary.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
